description: Non material minor adendment of planning permission ref: P101626 dated 15 December 2010 for the Demolition of the existing Twelve Acres Homeless Reception Centre buildings (including the single storey building that connects Riversdene House to the Twelve Acres buildings) and the construction of a 3 storey residential terrace and a part 2, part 5 storey residential flatted block fronting Riversdale Road and a three storey terrace fronting Highbury Quadrant to provide for 38 residential dwellings. The proposals include the relocation of substation services into the substation structure currently located in the east of the site (rear of the White House public house) and other associated works including boundary treatment and gates and other landscaping works. Note: Riversdene House is not to be demolished. Landscaping around this building is proposed and that is the reason for this buildings inclusion within the site.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Planning permission is only granted for the removal of trees: T5 (Poplar), T6 (Chennault's privet), T7 (Rowan), T8 (Manna Ash) and T9 (Rowan) as identified within the hereby approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment (D F Clarke Bionomique Ltd) Revision B dated 22 July 2010 on drawing no. DFCA 121 TPP dated 16.04.10.  

REASON:  In the interest of the protection of trees and to safeguard visual amenities in accordance with PPS9, policy 3D.15 of the London Plan 2008 and policy Env6 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002.
